title: Despair
verses: 2 Corinthians 4:8-9 (WEB) — "We are pressed on every side, yet not crushed; perplexed, yet not to despair; pursued, yet not forsaken; struck down, yet not destroyed;"
Psalm 42:5 (WEB) — "Why are you in despair, my soul? Why are you disturbed within me? Hope in God! For I shall still praise him for the saving help of his presence."

Lamentations 3:21-23 (WEB) — "This I recall to my mind; therefore I have hope. It is because of Yahweh’s loving kindnesses that we are not consumed, because his mercies don’t fail. They are new every morning. Great is your faithfulness."
Psalm 27:13-14 (WEB) — "I am still confident of this: I will see the goodness of Yahweh in the land of the living. Wait for Yahweh. Be strong, and let your heart take courage. Yes, wait for Yahweh."
Isaiah 40:31 (WEB) — "But those who wait for Yahweh will renew their strength. They will mount up with wings like eagles. They will run, and not be weary. They will walk, and not faint."
body: Despair is contradicted by remembrance. Speak hope to your soul, wait for the Lord, and you will find that His mercies rise like morning—strength enough for today.
prayer: Faithful God, restore my hope. Lift my eyes from what crushes me to Your steadfast love. Renew my strength as I wait on You. Amen.
